name: Curry Express
full_address: 90 W Madison Ave Unit C, Belgrade, MT 59714
working_hours: Monday: 11 AM-2:30 PM,5-9 PM, Tuesday: 11 AM-2:30 PM,5-9 PM, Wednesday: 11 AM-2:30 PM,5-9 PM, Thursday: 11 AM-2:30 PM,5-9 PM, Friday: 11 AM-2:30 PM,5-9 PM, Saturday: 11 AM-2:30 PM,5-9 PM, Sunday: Closed
Review 1: The BEST Indian food around!!Your taste buds will thank you. Dont hesitate go eat NOW! Food: 5/5  |  Service: 5/5  |  Atmosphere: 5/5
Review 2: The food at Curry Express is top-notch along with their always friendly service! Belgrade is lucky to have this place as a lunch option!
Review 3: I was happy with my chicken curry and garlic naan.  If you like spicy I would ask for spicier than medium, I asked for medium and wished for a bit more. The flavor was good. Not a ton of food so don‚Äôt plan on sharing. My desi girlfriend came with me, it was her suggestion because she loves Indian food. She wasn‚Äôt thrilled with her meal.  Our main complaint was the raita, it looked more like melted butter than yogurt which is what I‚Äôm used to. I understand that many places make raita differently but this didn‚Äôt really look like raita. I attached a picture, I‚Äôm curious what y‚Äôall think.
Review 4: Very very good food. Like reallllly good Indian food. Service and hours are hit and miss, wish they were more consistent in both, but they are also a very nice family. I think people in our area would go more if these things were figured out but don‚Äôt let that stop you. Worth it once you eat.
Review 5: I‚Äôve gone twice this week and both times I‚Äôve had a great experience, food is good and service is amazing. Nicola, the waitress is a gracious, detail oriented girl that takes care of every detail to make your experience outstanding

name: India Grill
working_hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11 AM-2:30 PM,4:30-9 PM, Wednesday: 11 AM-2:30 PM,4:30-9 PM, Thursday: 11 AM-2:30 PM,4:30-9 PM, Friday: 11 AM-2:30 PM,4:30-9 PM, Saturday: 11 AM-2:30 PM,4:30-9 PM, Sunday: 11 AM-2:30 PM,4:30-9 PM
Review 1: The food is amazing. I have had the butter chicken that melts in your mouth. I also had the beef marsala (I asked for extra spice) it had the perfect amount of heat. The meat was so tender and the sauce divine. The garlic Nan bread was also very good. I will be back to try other dishes forsure. The restaurant is very clean and the service is great!
Review 2: The place was nice and clean and the staff was friendly and the food is fantastic! My granddaughters and I are going back soon!
Review 3: Food is delicious!! Chicken korma or chicken curry is my favorite and my husband loves the lamb curry with some spice heat added. Must have the naan!! Onion and cilantro, cheese, or garlic and naan is all so good!
Review 4: Probably the best meal in US - can‚Äôt thank enough. We had a rough day & eventually ordered via Doordash! Couldn‚Äôt recommend authentic Indian more from this place
Review 5: Everything was real good and tasty except the paneer. It had the consistency of pencil erasers. The masala and Naan were excellent. I will try again someday and If it was a one off I will give it 5 stars.

name: Pakeezah Authentic Indian Restaurant
working_hours: Monday: 4-9:30 PM, Tuesday: 4-9:30 PM, Wednesday: 4-9:30 PM, Thursday: 4-9:30 PM, Friday: 4-9:30 PM, Saturday: 4-9:30 PM, Sunday: 4-9:30 PM
Review 1: If you're looking for great Indian food, definitely go here! It was a busy Saturday evening with only 3 waiters but the staff was kind and attentive. Very delicious food! Great atmosphere and wonderful Indian spice smell inside! The mango Lassi is so good too!
Review 2: Clean, great hospitality, and wonderful food. I ordered something not on the lunch menu and they were still happy to make it for me. I think this is family ran, very kind. Oh and the custom bar is really cool.
Review 3: Picked up food.online order. Food: chili chicken- spicy, kofta curry, veg biriyani, butter and bullet naan Chili chicken- so v sweet, a huge let down :( Kofta curry- the koftas were bad,doughy and inedible.the liquid curry was flavorful and good Naan- good Veg biriyy- not great.... but okay.
Review 4: Must try! We went their on Monday so the place wasn't crowded. We ordered some North Indian dishes and all of us were amazed by the taste. Didn't expect it from an Indian restaurant in Montana. I can say it is easily one of the best authentic Indian food places you'll find. Their staff is very accommodating and the service was also good. Not too expensive and definitely value for money.
Review 5: Food was okay, rather bland and lacking in spices. For an Indian restaurant in Montana this is to be expected and this was one of the only Indian restaurants that was within a semi-reasonable drive of West Yellowstone (about 1 and a half hours). The staff provided great service and that definitely made the experience better.

name: Saibeen's Kitchen
full_address: 1601 2nd Ave N suite 220, Great Falls, MT 59401
working_hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11 AM-7 PM, Wednesday: 11 AM-7 PM, Thursday: 11 AM-7 PM, Friday: Closed, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Review 1: Saibeen‚Äôs kitchen is the best place I‚Äôve eaten, in Great Falls MT. All the flavors, just enough heat. The warm service and joyous  personality are well worth the visit. Highly recommend this restaurant.  I am so pleased that this is a food choice in GF. We are excited to eat here again, dine in or take out.  All my family had a favorite dish, of six presented to us.
Review 2: Amazing and authentic Indian food.  We both had the Green Curry Chicken with coconut accent and it was phenomenal.  The atmosphere was great and the pieces around the restaurant were very cool.  The waitress and cook were also incredibly kind and welcoming.
Review 3: Absolutely excellent. The flavors were amazing and authentic. The spicy was actually spicy and it was perfect. Best food I‚Äôve had in great falls. They were also very accommodating to allergies and had plenty of options for everyone.
Review 4: Oh, my goodness! What a local gem! The food was amazing, the flavors were rich and savory. My toddler is picky, and she loved the curry chicken, naan, and cucumber coconut yogurt. The vegan daal was my favorite: spicy, hearty, and light. We shared a combo meal, and it was still enough for lunch and dinner. I'm already looking forward to next week's offering.
Review 5: ON THE SECOND FLOOR Beautiful vegetarian food. Can‚Äôt recommend enough! üôèüèª‚ù§Ô∏è

name: Masala
working_hours: Monday: 11:45 AM-3:30 PM,4:45-8 PM, Tuesday: 11:45 AM-3:30 PM,4:45-8 PM, Wednesday: 11:45 AM-3:30 PM,4:45-8 PM, Thursday: 11:45 AM-3:30 PM,4:45-8 PM, Friday: 11:45 AM-3:30 PM,4:45-8 PM, Saturday: 5-8 PM, Sunday: Closed
Review 1: Staff were great but not a typical Indian restaurant. It is mostly Americanized version of Indian food with rice bowl base with curry on top. Not so pricey but taste was average. Vegetarian options are available. Located in downtown corner with street parking only.
Review 2: One thing I miss about living in a big city is the food. It's easy to find a burger in MT, but this place is a rare find for the state. The food at Masala took me back home, but without all the traffic and horrible people which come with big city life. Will eat here again next time I'm in Missoula.
Review 3: We tried this place recently.  We had a beef and okra plate and a shawarma wrap plate.  Everything was freshly prepared and tasted excellent.  The staff was friendly.  Recommended!
Review 4: As others have said, the food is fresh and quite tasty. The offerings are not numerous but more than enough to have decent choices. As so many fast food companies have figured out, there is nothing wrong with sticking to basics. This is not "fast food" but you are sitting, eating quickly. Definitely adds variety to Missoula's limited culinary offerings.
Review 5: They have alot of really great authentic tasting food, and I'm only guessing at how the menu could be better, but I did have a little difficulty figuring out how it works. A great place for some spicy food with healthy options

name: Montana Bonfire
working_hours: Monday: 4-9 PM, Tuesday: 4-9 PM, Wednesday: 4-9 PM, Thursday: 4-9 PM, Friday: 4-10 PM, Saturday: 4-10 PM, Sunday: 4-9 PM
Review 1: Went for Indian Food night. Will definitely be back!
Review 2: Best experience dining I've had in a while. Food was delicious! Our waitress Arista was VERY attentive, and pleasant! I wasn't happy with my drink choice and she was able to get me something based on the taste I wanted.! Highly recommend this restaurant, great dining and atmosphere! Can't wait to try more of the amazing menu
Review 3: Absolutely delicious meal, one of the best we have had here. My husband and I are foodies and are very picky, we were so impressed. Great service, the Trout was excellant. Everything was so fresh and well prepared. Highly recommend this place!
Review 4: Delicious food. Small space. Probly a good idea to make a reservation. We didn't and we got in quickly but it filled up fast. Big portions and friendly staff. Drinks are good. It's a little more expensive than the surrounding restaurants but we enjoyed it.
Review 5: Servers were awesome and very attentive.  Place was spacious, but oddly decorated.  Food was promptly and freshly served, with the starters being the star of the show.

name: Nite Owl & Back Room Restaurants
working_hours: Monday: 7 AM-8 PM, Tuesday: 7 AM-8 PM, Wednesday: 7 AM-8 PM, Thursday: 1:30 AM-8 PM, Friday: 7 AM-8 PM, Saturday: 7 AM-8 PM, Sunday: 7 AM-8 PM
Review 1: The best boasted chicken and Indian fry bread. Delicious food.
Review 2: We were told by some folks from Libby to try the Back Room if ever we were in Columbia Falls. Good fortune for us as we were! Hubby had the broasted chicken dinner. He loves fried chicken and I don't make it. So, he is double lucky when he can find broasted chicken. I had the beef brisket dinner. Lots of food, more than enough for four let alone the two of us! Everything was good and they also make Indian fry bread. Couldn't ask for a better meal, famous for their bar-b-que!
Review 3: Delicious local BBQ and that Indian fry bread - to die for!
Review 4: Had dinner here with friends and we all loved our food. I had the rib sampler which was excellent. Generous portions, enough for leftovers. Sides are usual barbecue sides, but the fry bread is great! Slather honey butter on it and call it desert. Also had Bear Food mixed berry hard cider. Wow!
Review 5: Finally!! I was beginning to think this area had no good food but we really enjoyed our meal here. Considering the other places it was a great value. Good service. Our only issue was the ribs came out cold but they took care of it. My rotisseries chicken was juicy and had a great flavor. Loved all the sides that came with it. Highly recommend.

name: Bollywood Grill
working_hours: Monday: 11:30 AM-3 PM,5-9:30 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 11:30 AM-3 PM,5-9:30 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM-3 PM,5-9:30 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM-3 PM,5-9:30 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM-3 PM,5-10 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM-3 PM,5-10 PM
Review 1: My Daughter is 12 years old, She ordered the butter chicken for her and Myself so we could go to the drive in theater. We had to wait an hour and the other patrons had big bags of food. The highest price I heard the rude lady say was $57.65. and he had a lot of food, she hands Me the small bag and says $70.00 ok no problem but when My Daughter went in the bag to get her food. Everything was for 1 person, a small box of Jasmine Rice and a container of butter chicken that we could not eat individually. The hostess was rude I felt overcharged for our food purposely and we couldn't eat til we got home. I paid close to $100 for bad service and the kids running around the food in the kitchen where customers can see them. I would bring many to them but I don't want to be embarrassed because of their service. Rude lady should take a course on being a good hostess.
Review 2: We were traveling from Massachusetts to New York when we came across this restaurant and so glad we found it. It was really late and all other restaurants on the way had closed for the day. We were starving and just happened to call them to see if they were open. We reached just as they were about to close but the owners were kind to let us dine in. We had veg biryani, paneer kadai and garlic naan. Biryani ani kadai was good. The naan was slightly uncooked. The dahi raita was sour and slightly butter so we couldn't eat it. Overall good experience. The decor was nice, restrooms were clean.
Review 3: Had a dinner here with my colleague. We ordered Amritsari Dal, bhindi and garlic naans. For appetizers we wanted gobi manchurian which was not on menu but we asked. Hostess suggested we try gobi 65 which was not on menu either but she said chef will make it. It was amazing. Crunchy gobi with lots of flavor. Dal and Bhindi was awesome too. Naans we‚Äôre one of the best. It is very authentic Punjabi restaurant so if you want to eat good Punjabi food, go here.
Review 4: This is the best Indian food I have had since moving to this area. The samosas are excellent and the Chicken Vindaloo is the best I have every had. It is perfectly spicy and vinegary. If you enjoy spicy food, I highly recommend their Vindaloo. I‚Äôm sure the lamb and veggie Vindaloo would be great as well. Excellent garlic naan as well. I will absolutely be back soon!
Review 5: We enjoyed our time here. The server was quick to get the appetizer running but the entrees took longer than we expected it to be. The goat biryani was amazing as well as the chicken kadhai.

name: Chaska
working_hours: Monday: 12-9 PM, Tuesday: 12-9 PM, Wednesday: 12-9 PM, Thursday: 12-9 PM, Friday: 12-9 PM, Saturday: 12-9 PM, Sunday: 12-9 PM
Review 1: Most of the food was good. Chutney can be a little less tangy as it was overpowering the taste of chicken. Amritsari Kulcha was just next level amazing though. Definitely a must try.
Review 2: Good food and good drinks right in the shopping plaza.  Paneer comes in nice large pieces that are flame grilled. They have an open concept kitchen so you can see right inside as they prepare your meal.
Review 3: We went to this amazing restaurant in spring ‚Äò21 during a family trip to Newport. That was the first time we tried Indian cuisine and‚Ä¶OMG‚Ä¶ we fell in love   The interior is absolutely beautiful, stylish and vibrant. The food was irresistible delicious, we couldn‚Äôt stop eating until we finished our meal to the very last crumble on the plate. Our overall experience was terrific. Thanks to the owner for the love, attention to the details and care of their place. I wish your business  prosperity for years and hope one day we‚Äôll come back
Review 4: The flavors and combinations served here are mind blowing! Highly recommend the samosas and calamari for appetizer. We had chicken korma and lamb roganjosh for main course, and saffron pistachio dessert. Phenomenal!!l
Review 5: The food here is the best Indian food around! I love to order the mango chicken even though it's not on the menu. I drive 50 minutes out of the way to go here. The parking sucks because it's in the same lot as the rest of the stores but it's so worth it!

name: Chennai Express - Indian Cuisine
Review 1: Best ever Indian food I have tried in US. Especially try their Chicken 555 and Tawa fish you will absolutely will love that and also they serve best South Indian food items. Highly recommended üòç
Review 2: Yummm. Authentic Chole Bhatura (don‚Äôt miss). Amazing Onion Rava Masala Dosa. If you can‚Äôt imagine how one restaurant can serve both ‚Äúflawless‚Äù dishes, one from Deep South and one from deep Punjab, then check them out and decide for your self.
Review 3: Management has changed, chef changed and whole experience changed. Some money making Indian wanting to just run a restaurant with stale foods! Change your decision if you ever planned to have that desperate Indian food at this place.
Review 4: I was told to try out this restaurant because it‚Äôs so good. Well I got the chicken tikka masala and the chicken was good, but it didn‚Äôt come with any rice. I called about the issue and was told if I wanted rice I‚Äôd have to pay for it. I immediately lost my appetite after that and didn‚Äôt finish the food. I paid over $20 for chicken only üòë. Very disappointing. This has to be a joke. I hope the restaurant see‚Äôs this as an error.
Review 5: Wow. This is Excellent Indian. Chennai is truly a must try.  This is as authentic Indian as you will find here in Rhode Island. I am in awe that a place this amazing sits in a hole in the wall on Reservoir Ave.  Everytime I am here the restaurant is filled with individuals enjoying their meal. Smiling, laughing and sharing time over great food. High praise to the family at Chennai for bringing us wonderful food with great flavor. You can tell they love what they do. You can taste the love in the food. Great job Chennai and thank you! We will see you soon. Pictures are of Tikki Massala and I tried the Kadai Chicken. Delish and something new for a lot of individuals.

name: Chennai Tiffins
working_hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11 AM-3 PM,5-8 PM, Wednesday: 11 AM-3 PM,5-9 PM, Thursday: 11 AM-3 PM,5-9 PM, Friday: 11 AM-3 PM,5-9 PM, Saturday: 11 AM-3 PM,5-9 PM, Sunday: 11 AM-3 PM,5-8 PM
Review 1: We got a takeaway of samosa and masala Dosa from here.Samosas were good. But masala Dosas was opposite of samosas. They did not have any tase. The masala stuffing  they had stuffed it with had 0 salt and we felt like we should not have ordered the masala Dosas.
Review 2: Authentic and delicious Indian Cuisine. This food was hot and ready when I arrived to pick it up. The curry was amazing and I can‚Äôt wait to get it again!
Review 3: After ordering takeout from here several times, I can attest that Chennai Tiffins has THE most authentic South Indian food in the area, with an amazing variety of Chettinad specialties.  Some of my favorite menu items include onion pakoras, podi idli, vegetable kothu parotta, and chettinad vegetable biryani.  Very fresh, flavorful, and aromatic with a complex mixture of spices. Nice assortment of condiments (mint cilantro chutney, tamarind chutney, spicy pakora sauce, raita) as well.  Best to call in orders for pickup.  Very reasonably priced, highly recommended.
Review 4: Best place in entire RI to get authentic South Indian food. Especially It‚Äôs really good for non vegetarians items.
Review 5: The food is good, especially the Biryanis. We went there for a dine-in but it is geared more towards take away.

name: Curry Kitchen , Authentic Indian Cuisine and Hookah Bar
working_hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11:30 AM-3 PM,4:30-10 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM-3 PM,4:30-10 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM-3 PM,4:30-10 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM-3 PM,4:30-10 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM-3 PM,4:30-10 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM-3 PM,4:30-9:30 PM
Review 1: The food here is incredible! We found this spot on a whim and were not disappointed. The buffet is $20/person and everything is delicious. Cannot recommend this place enough!
Review 2: Really good atmosphere!! Great place to enjoy with family. Service is really fast and food is finger licking good. One of the best  chicken tandoori, kadhai chicken and Palak paneer I ever had. And price is reasonably good. One of the best Indian restaurants !!!
Review 3: Good Indian restaurant in Rhode Island. Seating is good and food is tasty. We tried chole bhature and devil's chicken.both items are tasty.
Review 4: This cozy restaurant has left the best impressions! One of the best Indian restaurant in east coast, Hospitable hosts, delicious Indian dishes, beautiful presentation. I recommend to everyone! I would like to come back here again and again. Don‚Äôt forget to try chicken momo
Review 5: Amazing food!! I tried a lot of the buffet options and was definitely NOT disappointed! There was nothing I didn't like, but the chili chicken and the goat were may absolute favorites. Very friendly staff too! It was a great experience!

name: Curry Walla Indian Cuisine
working_hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10 AM-3 PM,5-9:30 PM, Wednesday: 10 AM-3 PM,5-9:30 PM, Thursday: 10 AM-3 PM,5-9:30 PM, Friday: 10 AM-3 PM,5-9:30 PM, Saturday: 10 AM-3 PM,5-9:30 PM, Sunday: 10 AM-3 PM,5-9:30 PM
Review 1: Curry Walla Indian Cuisine make good Indian food. After I order within no time the food was ready. The food was amazing and to much to finish.  I will be back to try more food. My first time eating Indian food.
Review 2: We went on a Sunday and I think they just opened. The service was outstanding. We had chicken vindaloo, lamb masala and chicken curry. We also got the soup, the flavor was perfectly spicy and bright.  Every bite was better than the one before.
Review 3: Nice restaurant. Good taste. Affordable prices. Ample car parking. Good enough seating.
Review 4: Decent serving sizes and courteous staff; they have to make up their mind between upscale ambience vs canteen type of food. Need to pick one of the two lanes üòä
Review 5: Visit this place on a winter afternoon for lunch with my husband and a friend. We started with non-veg platter which had chicken pakora, chicken samosa and chicken Tikka. All of these tasted fresh and did not feel like the usual frozen ones from supermarket. Then we ordered fish pakora. Along with this we ordered chicken soup little spicy. The starters were very delicious. For the main course, we ordered 2 thalis, and goat biryani. The quantity is more than usual restaurant and very delicious.The attending person, Prakash is very soft spoken and asked for feedback if the food is ok. Finally they also gave us tea before leaving.

name: CurryLand
working_hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11 AM-10 PM, Wednesday: 11 AM-10 PM, Thursday: 11 AM-10 PM, Friday: 11 AM-10 PM, Saturday: 11 AM-10 PM, Sunday: 11 AM-9:30 PM
Review 1: Out of all the Indian restaurants I have tried, Curryland slaps every time! So good
Review 2: I have eaten at Curryland a few times since they opened earlier this year and each time it has been excellent.  They do a great job of preparing the traditional Indian dishes and provide a customized blend upon request.  Additionally, during lunch they have a buffet that allows newcomers to Indian foods the opportunity to sample a bit of several different dishes to determine what they like.  Very friendly staff who are there to help find what you might like best.  Highly recommended to anyone who is looking for a great lunch and/or dinner.
Review 3: Excellent Indian cuisine! My family and I go here all the time, and everything we‚Äôve tried has been delicious. The curries are a savory delight, the naan is fresh and buttery, and the chicken is succulent and well seasoned. My personal favorites are the Vegetable Samosas, and the Chicken Tika Masala.
Review 4: Authentic Indian food with great appetizers and desserts. The service was quick and food was tasty. The naans were crisp and the food quantity was good enough. Although the rates were a bit pricey, the quality of food makes up for it. Will surely visit this place again when I am in Rhode Island.
Review 5: Whenever I want Indian food. This is the place. It‚Äôs the only only good place I found in Rhode Island. The staff is welcoming and accommodating. The cooks are experts and your food comes in perfect time. The chicken tika massala and the naan blow my mind. If you come here you will not be disappointed. ü§§üòã

name: Godavari South Indian Restaurant
working_hours: Monday: 11 AM-2:30 PM,5:30-10 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 11 AM-2:30 PM,5:30-10 PM, Thursday: 11 AM-2:30 PM,5:30-10 PM, Friday: 11 AM-3:30 PM,5:30-10:30 PM, Saturday: 11 AM-3:30 PM,5:30-10:30 PM, Sunday: 11 AM-3:30 PM,5:30-10 PM
Review 1: Nice tasty food worth the money.. less oily, cooked to perfection and satisfies your taste buds!!
Review 2: My husband is from India and gets homesick occasionally for really authentic Indian meals. We came for the Sunday buffet and this absolutely hit the spot. The food is so fresh and the staff are very attentive. Great service all around. We'll definitely be back!
Review 3: Hit or miss. First time try was good so we went again and had a bad experience. The dosa, Gobi Manchuria was good. Bajji was so oily that I had to squeeze out oil. Kadai paneer was ok. We had to mix in salt and pepper to bring it to taste. Not an experience I want to have when paying good price. One another customer was so mad with the food that they were going to call the department of health for serving frozen expired food!
Review 4: The shrimp was so overcooked that it was like we were chewing on rubber. The food overall was just below average in flavor profile and execution. The only reason that this place gets a 2 star is because of how kind and welcoming the wait staff was.
Review 5: One of the best South Indian Restaurant in the area! Huge menu and all delicious! They serve lunch buffet and they even serve the Bahubali Thali - which has 50 items on the plate! I love the biryanis, Chile bhature, Idli and Dosa!

name: Humming Bird
working_hours: Monday: 4-8 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: Closed, Friday: Closed, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Review 1: Wow, the flavor is incredible. The owner was so gracious and chatted with us a bit. Definitely bringing family to try this special place.
Review 2: The food is always great and perfectly seasoned.  I‚Äôve tried just about everything on their menu (oxtails are my favorite) and I‚Äôm never disappointed. The staff are always friendly and professional. To the owners keep up the great service.
Review 3: The food was very delicious and the staff were super nice. Really liked the fried plantains, chicken curry, and chicken stew.
Review 4: One of the best restaurants in Newport! Great menu of authentic Jamaican food, nice atmosphere, and friendly staff. Ox-tail and jerk chicken are highlights!
Review 5: Great selection of Jamaican style dishes, from sandwiches to full entrees.  The staff was very helpful and the food was excellent. Really good spot for a relaxing lunch.

name: India Restaurant
working_hours: Monday: 11 AM-10 PM, Tuesday: 11 AM-10 PM, Wednesday: 11 AM-10 PM, Thursday: 11 AM-10 PM, Friday: 11 AM-11 PM, Saturday: 11 AM-11 PM, Sunday: 11 AM-10 PM
Review 1: This is hands-down the best Indian Restaurant in the north east! The decor, the staff and the food. Decor  - Beautiful, Staff - the sweetest. Music - Fun! Food - absolutely delicious! This was our first time & Tita made sure we had everything we need and made our experience amazing. ‚ù§ Thank you so much team India Restaurant.  Will certainly be coming back again and again and again and again! üòá
Review 2: One of my fav spots in town, perfect for a date of any kind! Delicious food, friendly and attentive staff, strong drinks and great portions! Quality Indian food within a moody, cultural decor sure to leave a lasting impression! Do try the veggie masala and garlic naan!! You won‚Äôt regret it.
Review 3: Incredible experience at India Restaurant. The ambiance was first-rate. The server was helpful, friendly, and attentive. The food was delicious (we got the dining for two deal, getting the Mango Curry and the Fish Curry for our entrees). This was truly a memorable dining spot for me and my wife.
Review 4: I had never ventured into Indian food until meeting my partner in 2019. He finally got to take me to India and he can do it again. The door opens and the smell of curry ignites your hunger. Everything is cooked to perfection. The taste is better than imagined. Venture out and try India.
Review 5: India is one of Providence's best restaurants in general and a cultural gem for the city. The atmosphere, lighting, and general feel of the setting is perfect to match their menu. Service was excellent, very helpful in catering to any special requests. Food was delicious as expected. Many seating options, inside and outside, the menu is very fairly priced for the quality of food you are getting. A great selection of cocktails and drinks to choose from, typically busy on weekend nights but they also have an in house Henna artist doing free henna work available to patrons, a great opportunity.

name: Indian Accent Catering
Review 1: Wonderful people to work with and great quality food. They offer really good suggestions and are very considerate when thinking about the menu for your event. We used them for our wedding and did not even consider going with someone else for an upcoming event.

name: Kabob and Curry
working_hours: Monday: 11 AM-9:30 PM, Tuesday: 11 AM-9:30 PM, Wednesday: 11 AM-9:30 PM, Thursday: 11 AM-9:30 PM, Friday: 11 AM-10 PM, Saturday: 11 AM-10 PM, Sunday: 11 AM-9 PM
Review 1: 2nd time here! The food is incredible! It was my birthday and the perfect way to celebrate. Just such an amazing experience. Mustafa was our server and he made it a great experience. Very knowledgeable of the food and very nice. Thank you.
Review 2: Excellent food at a fair price.  Each dish nicely presented and cooked well. Service was  great. Attentive staff without being rushed. Will definitely visit again.
Review 3: The food here was excellent! The different flavors were very savory! The waiter Mustafa was a great server and made terrific recommendations, since it was my first time eating here. If you want to try something new and enjoy Indian food this place has authentic Indian cuisine!
Review 4: I ordered the lamb saag medium spice with honey ginger naan and the service was fast and the food delicious. I love coming here with friends and it‚Äôs my favorite place to get authentic Indian food!
Review 5: My favorite is their weekend Thali which you can have few small plates of curry and veggies with rice or Naan. I also like their mango curry and chicken masala with honey Naan.

name: Masala Indian Cuisine
working_hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11:30 AM-9:45 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM-9:45 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM-9:45 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM-9:45 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM-9:45 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM-9 PM
Review 1: This was my first time ordering Indian cuisine. Let me tell you... it was DELICIOUS! I placed my order online, it was very user friendly. When I arrived, it was ready in the amount of time stated and the gentleman that rang me out was very nice and confirmed everything in my order. I will definitely be ordering from this restaurant again.... SOON!  :)
Review 2: Up until yesterday we've only have had done delivery but decided to come dine in this time. We decided to try different menu items from our usual and let me tell you that so many flavors were dancing on our tastebuds! Every bite was incredibly delicious and the food was reasonably priced for all that we got. Our waitress was very knowledgeable, attentive and informative. Will be returning for dine in and or ordering takeout again in the future.
Review 3: Another great meal at Masala. Located near to all your favorite shopping centers in Bald Hill road tucked in there West Warwick, RI and worth the drive from distance. The food is exceptional and freshly prepared if eating in like we did or with take out. The aroma and spice is wonderfully combined into both Indian and Pakistan traditional dishes that are worth the trip, like we did from North Providence! The service was personable and so very attentive and I know that Sahara will take good care of you too! Don't miss out on this local gem!
Review 4: Went for lunch. Great food and awesome hospitality. The young female waitress is very knowledgeable and passionate about her job. She made it super easy to decide on what we wanted. Always good food and nice service. Thank you for myself and wife's wonderful experience here. ‚ù§Ô∏èüòä
Review 5: The food was so amazing me and my girlfriend had to order again the very next day. Staff is very nice and considerate, overall great experience will definitely be eating hear again :)

name: Not Just Snacks
working_hours: Monday: 11 AM-9 PM, Tuesday: 11 AM-9 PM, Wednesday: 11 AM-9 PM, Thursday: 11 AM-9 PM, Friday: 11 AM-9 PM, Saturday: 11 AM-9 PM, Sunday: 11 AM-9 PM
Review 1: Real india food here. I was generally satisfied with them. But the price was a little bit expencive for me.
Review 2: I got the paneer tikka masala with garlic naan and it was delicious!! Perfect seasoning and flavor.
Review 3: A descent Indian restaurant with a good food. You have so many options to choose, and every choice is a good choice if you love Indian food. Also, the place is not fancy at all and you can bring your own bottle.
Review 4: It was absolutely great. We've been to other places and this one had the best variety, the best flavoring and more personal attention.  We didn't even leave yet and already discussing going back again.
Review 5: This place is honestly the most solid, delicious, and consistent Indian restaurant in Rhode Island. Food always on point and the prices are good. My only gripe, which doesn't matter in the slightest, is that I wish they had more comfortable seating for when you decide to dine in.

name: Providence Biryani
working_hours: Monday: 12 PM-12 AM, Tuesday: 12 PM-12 AM, Wednesday: 12 PM-12 AM, Thursday: 12 PM-12 AM, Friday: 2 PM-12 AM, Saturday: 12 PM-12 AM, Sunday: 12 PM-12 AM
Review 1: This was not a good experience, or good food. Lamb gyro with rice was dry, lettuce was old. Will never return. But the guy who gave me the food was very nice.
Review 2: This is a takeout/pickup place only. The street view in the Google Maps is inaccurate. Please see the photo below of takeout entrance.
Review 3: Food was so yummy, chicken biryani is sooo good, very authentic. I also am a big fan of the kheer! Its also all halal
Review 4: Placed call for pick up and was told order will be ready in 25-30 min. Arrived 45 min later and was told by gentleman behind the counter "it would be awhile" and said he couldn't elaborate. My order was also not listed as even placed on the overhead tracker. I would recommend you try a different indian restaurant
Review 5: Bland fries are called seasoned fries . Also one item was missing from the order . The seekh kabab was broken half like someone ate the rest .

name: Rasa Restaurant
working_hours: Monday: 11:30 AM-9 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM-9 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM-9 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM-9 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM-9:30 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM-9:30 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM-9 PM
Review 1: I got here a little late, my expectations where a bit lowered based on the fact that  I got there 15 min. Before closing. ordered the mix Grill. Owner was very focused on the quality of the meal. And man, was the meal phenomenal. Especially the lamb portion. HIGHLY RECOMMEND  you try this place.
Review 2: So SO good! The tamarind margarita was incredible, service was very friendly, and the food was amazing. There are so many things I want to go back and try. Very fairly priced - $40 each for a drink/apps/meal.
Review 3: The best Indian food I've had. Owner/Manager is very friendly and nice. Staff is wonderful. Great cocktails you will find no where else. Beautiful inside.  Nice street setup for summer nights. Easy to order on line and pick up.
Review 4: We were here for the first time and ordered take out while returning from RI to MA. The food ü•ò we ordered was Ragda Patis, Cauliflower 65, kulcha,  Veg Biryani. The portion was good and the food was üòã tasty. The Veg biryani needs special for the attention to detail it was given while preparation.
Review 5: Outstanding Indian! The small plates and cocktails steal the show. But everything is authentic. Everything is flavorful. This is top quality Indian cuisine. Great to see South Asian Americans dining here. I have to give high marks to the cocktails. The spiced old fashioned is best old fashioned I've ever had, and the Old Monk dark and stormy is also a winner. A great find on a strip full of good and great restaurants.

name: Rasoi
working_hours: Monday: 11:30 AM-9:30 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM-9:30 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM-9:30 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM-9:30 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM-9:30 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM-9:30 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM-9 PM
Review 1: Nice place, clean. Food Was good. The drink I had, not quite my taste, but I tried something new. You can sit outside.  Clean restroom.
Review 2: I‚Äôve been coming here for years. They always have good quality paneer. Love the food. The Chicken Tikka app is my favorite. They recently started upgrading the inside a bit at a time and I like the way it looks now. Lunch portions are a good size and super reasonable priced. (Like $10) they have a few vegan options too so I can go out with my vegan friends
Review 3: We went here on a weekend for dinner, ambience was good. Food tasted nice but was quite heavy on the stomach. We ordered dhokla, aloo tikki chaat, veg biryani and jackfruit masala. Dhokla was super dry, aloo tikki was really good, biryani was good but more like a pulao, jackfruit was okay. Servers and management are attentive and warm.
Review 4: This restaurant is the best Indian Restaurant! The food is absolutely delicious and flavorful! The employees, management and everyone there always make you feel welcome and goes out of their way to make sure you are enjoying your meal! If you haven‚Äôt been here you are missing out! I can‚Äôt even name just one favorite because everything is fantastic but if I had to it would be Shrimp Madras and Aloo Gobi!
Review 5: My friend and I went here for lunch. The lunch special was so plentiful, yummy, and affordable. My friend who is a little more high maintenance than myself was also pleased. We marveled at how clean everything was including the restroom. Service was sweet and our ice teas were marvelous. In the mood for Indian food, this is the place to go.

name: Swagat Indian Food
working_hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 5-9 PM, Thursday: 5-9 PM, Friday: 5-9 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM-2:30 PM,5-9 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM-2:30 PM,5-9 PM
Review 1: If you are new to Rhode Island, then you must try coming here. It‚Äôs great place to eat north & South Indian food.
Review 2: They serve warm and fresh food to all their guests. You see the efforts they put once you taste their menu. Everyday they have something special. Not to miss their Lunch buffet on Friday. I highly recommend it to all Indian cuisine lovers.
Review 3: My favorite restaurant we love every dish they prepare, especially pesarattu upma every weekend, idli more, all items are fresh and very good. When i got sick i ate food from them everyday by to go orders ( bought by my hubby) and my tummy was happy in recovering process. Healthy to eat everyday as well which i discovered from here fresh tasty yummy food üç± Thanks Andi
Review 4: The taste and quality of the food here is always consistent and tasty. The owner is very humble and willing to hear out to customers. The idlis are like a pieces of cloud and Dosa qualifies the golden color check (unlike the ghost dose that most restaurants serve). Must try if you are in this area.
Review 5: Their South Indian food cuisine is top notch, especially their dosas and chole bahture! Although the space is small there is a lot of love! The owner of the restaurant was very kind and helpful.

name: Taj Indian Restaurant & Bar
full_address: 49 S County Commons Way, South Kingstown, RI 02879
working_hours: Monday: 11:30 AM-9 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM-9 PM, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 11:30 AM-9 PM, Friday: Closed, Saturday: 11:30 AM-9 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM-9 PM
Review 1: I just love their food. I am a picky eater and so is my family. We love coming here for Indian food. We have also used Taj Restaurant for small event catering. They have been really great.
Review 2: Wonderful restaurant.  Service was a bit scattered, but I am giving servers a pass during the pandemic.  Most importantly, the food was delicious!  I live spicy food, but I have learned not the ask for "hot" in an Indian restaurant.  Medium was just fine to give me the kick I wanted without intense pain.  I had goat, and it melted in my mouth.  My wife had a vegan avocado dish.  She couldn't stop singing it's praises.  We came here to celebrate our 26th anniversary and we weren't disappointed.
Review 3: Good naan and tasty sauce. $2 extra for garlic naan vs plain naan. Dry chicken. Slow in dining service. Attentive water refills. Quiet and not busy. On the expensive side of things. Entrees can be portioned into 2 servings.
Review 4: Amazing, amazing, amazing! We were walking past this new restaurant and wanted to check it out. The food came out just amazing, the naans were full of onion and garlic making it the best we have ever tried. We also tried the fried okras which is 10/10. The cauliflower tasted great too. The waitress Ritu was also very knowledgeable and recommended some of the dishes that were outside of our comfort zone and tasted great! Will definitely come back!
Review 5: Let me first start off by saying that the food was very authentic and fresh, and I highly recommend a visit.  My only knock was most likely due to a staffing shortage, as 1 person was visible doing everything to wait on all tables.  Food took a while to arrive.

name: Taste of India Restaurant
working_hours: Monday: 11:30 AM-8:45 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 11:30 AM-8:45 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM-8:45 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM-8:45 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM-8:45 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM-8:45 PM
Review 1: Indian restaurants are my favorite. This one was the worst I‚Äôve been to in regards of the taste. The food has no spice, not even salt or pepper. Plus, it‚Äôs small portions and expensive. The place was nice, the waitress was nice, another employee too but unfortunately, I came here expecting to have, above all, good food.
Review 2: Great service and the food was yummy and very generous  with the portion of food I would recommend this place.
Review 3: Lamb and chicken masala were delicious and the tandoori too!! The naan and rice were so good. Definitely recommend
Review 4: Average food, staff lacks interest. not allergy aware, told me they could not guarantee specific ingredient will not be in my food (lemon juice). when asked for a piece of onion, informed me it will cost $2.25 for "Indian salad". I have never ever been charged extra for a piece of onion in any Indian restaurant before this.
Review 5: Great samosas, great garlic naan, great mango lassi, and great papadams. Their chicken tikka masala is also excellent and the lunch portion is generous. Reason for the four star review is their chicken vindaloo. It really lacked the spice, tang, and the wow factor that I usually get from a great vindaloo. It‚Äôs my go to dish and this left me very disappointed. However, everything else was so good I‚Äôll definitely be back and will try something else!

name: The Punjab Indian and Himalayan Cuisine
working_hours: Monday: 11 AM-9 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 11 AM-9 PM, Thursday: 11 AM-9 PM, Friday: 11 AM-9 PM, Saturday: 10 AM-9 PM, Sunday: 10 AM-9 PM
Review 1: Food was fantastic and the vegetable samosas were the best I've had anywhere in a long time. My chicken curry was delicious and very plentiful. Dine in service was top notch and everyone was very pleasant and welcoming. I look forward to going back!
Review 2: Food was simply amazing !!  If you‚Äôd really wanna try some himalayan / indian food then this is the perfect place in town !! Will rate them 10/10 for the taste , food quality , cleanliness and service !!
Review 3: For folks like me we enjoy eating a eclectic variety of foods at just as many restaurants. Yet when it comes to Indian, we are looking for a local business that serves intoxicatingly aromatic and great food, to  return to over and over again. Punjab is that place. Fresh food, great service and a wonderful atmosphere. That and all at the best prices within 20 miles of any establishment serving Indian around!?  Moments from 295 right there on plainfield pike, so do not miss out!! You will not be sorry!
Review 4: Had a one of a kind experience! Everything from the service, to the food, to the environment, it was great! We got here at 8pm-ish and we got excellent service! You don't normally see that! Our waiter was attentive and friendly! Even brought out a spice he wanted us to try and it was amazing! Really, felt like a VIP or something at this place! Oh and their menu, literally is amazing!
Review 5: Ordered food to go and it was ready in a flash and still nice and hot when we ate it.  Had butter chicken and ordered medium heat which was the right amount for me.  Also ordered garlic naan and ginger/honey naan.  Both good. Lots and lots of ginger so it you do not like whole ginger this wouldn‚Äôt be for you. I happen to love it so was delighted. Very clean and easy to find.  Will dine in next time for the full experience.  Portions a little smaller than our typical go to place for Indian food - that‚Äôs the only reason for the 4 stars.

name: KOLACHI Pakistani Restaurant
working_hours: Wednesday: 11 AM-9 PM, Thursday: 11 AM-9 PM, Friday: 11 AM-9 PM, Saturday: 11 AM-9 PM, Sunday: 10 AM-9 PM, Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11 AM-9 PM
Review 1: Warm and genuine service, complimentary salad with a delicious spicy cilantro sauce. Food was great and the atmosphere was comfortable despite no music playing. It was a shame for this place to be empty on a Saturday night!
Review 2: Food was amazing,  chapli kabab were so big the chicken tikka was really good very juicy.,Naan is soo soft and buttery,Nihari was so tasty muttan Briyani was also very yummy its a great place to go if you want some amazing desi food they also serve breakfast i will definitly be going againüòÅ.
Review 3: We ordered food for takeout from here and thoroughly enjoyed every bite of it. I had the Chapli kebab and the white karahi, which were simply phenomenal. This place definitely lived up to my expectations, and we will undoubtedly order from here again.
Review 4: Great place, loved it very much. Nihari was good and so was the Hakeem. They had nice service. Definitely will come back.
Review 5: I recently had the pleasure of trying KOLACHI's nihari and it was absolutely amazing! The flavors were bold and the meat was incredibly tender. I was truly impressed by the quality of the dish. I highly recommend KOLACHI to anyone in search of authentic, delicious Pakistani cuisine. Five stars!

name: Mehfil Indian Cuisine
working_hours: Wednesday: 11:30 AM-2:30 PM,5-10 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM-2:30 PM,5-10 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM-2:30 PM,5-10:30 PM, Saturday: 12-3:30 PM,5-10:30 PM, Sunday: 12-3:30 PM,5-9:30 PM, Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11:30 AM-2:30 PM,5-10 PM
Review 1: We did order both veg and non veg appetizers and main course, food was fantastic, very good ambiance and owner and staff were very very hospitable. Strongly recommend this restaurant for Indian cuisine and delicacy foods
Review 2: Finally an Indian restaurant in Woonsocket! I got veg samosas, chicken tiki masala, butter chicken & garlic naan. Everything was delicious. My fav was the tiki masala. It had so much flavor. The chicken was white breast meat and was nice & tender. Samosas are a good deal since you get 3 per order. I wish them luck.
Review 3: A hidden gem. My husband and I really enjoyed our dinner. Friendly helpful staff. All food was delicious and timely. Very clean as well. Will be returning
Review 4: Everything was delicious!  We got the butter chicken, garlic naan bread, and paneer tikka masala and they were both so good!!! I can‚Äôt wait to try other menu items.
Review 5: It's a new India Restaurant in the vicinity and it's really good. The taste is far better compared to many competitors nearby. We tried Mutton Biriyani, Chilli Chicken, Chepala Pulusu(Fish curry). Every dish was perfect. Must try India Restaurant.

name: Bombay Deluxe Indian Restaurant
full_address: 555 W Northern Lights Blvd Suite 102, Anchorage, AK 99503
working_hours: Sunday: 11 AM-9 PM, Monday: 11 AM-9 PM, Tuesday: 11 AM-9 PM, Wednesday: 11 AM-9 PM, Thursday: 11 AM-9 PM, Friday: 11 AM-9 PM, Saturday: 11 AM-9 PM
Review 1: We had a mixed experience here. Two dishes were fine and one dish was salty. Portions are pretty small and the price is on the higher side. The staff can be more welcoming. Path to the restroom is clumsy and sort of demonstrated the unhygienic conditions. Also the raw materials like tomatoes were from Costco cans. Parking is plenty and shared.
Review 2: Clean, beautiful d√©cor matched with lovely East Indian music. Rich, flavorful, culturally authentic food with MANY GLUTEN FREE CHOICES! We had Chicken Makhni & Lamb Saag with Basmati Rice (all GF). My friend had the Butter Naan flat bread (not GF) and she said the texture and flavor was perfect. A little pricey but good portions and great, friendly service. Going back soon! See you there! . . . Almost forgot dessert! Never had anything like Gulab Japan . . . so delicious!! Namaste!
Review 3: I honestly don‚Äôt know what took me so long to try Indian food! We ordered Butter & Garlic Naan bread which were so freaking amazing and also ordered Chicken Vindaloo. My mom and I could not shut up about it because it was just that amazing! Also not pictured but highly recommended is trying their Mango Lassi & Indian Masala Iced Tea ü§§
Review 4: Fantastic, flavorful Indian cuisine, clear social distancing rules, and open for dine-in or take out. They no longer are serving their lunch buffet (for now), but their new lunch specials allow you to make a mini-buffet for yourself or to share. They have both vegetarian and vegan options and will customize the spice to suit your tastes. The vibe is cozy and well decorated with wood panels and cultural accents. Server was so kind and the chef was a cool, friendly guy. Seriously, folks, there's nothing but love waiting for you at Bombay. Come get some!
Review 5: Used to be 5 star. Over the last year though, the quality has decreased to where it is today. Just spent $100 on chicken and lamb Tikka masala that tastes like spicy tomato bisque. Doesn't even have any vegetables, and the meat is sparing. A far cry from the quality of a year ago. Will not be returning.

name: Taste of India
working_hours: Sunday: 12-9 PM, Monday: 11 AM-9 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 11 AM-9 PM, Thursday: 11 AM-9 PM, Friday: 11 AM-9 PM, Saturday: 12-9 PM
Review 1: Good Indian food with lots of options to choose from. They will customize according to your instructions. We tried 3 meals during our stay in Anchorage and never disappoints us. Curious and friendly customer service. Highly recommended this place. Vegetarian options: Vegetable biryani and other mixed vegi items
Review 2: Taste of India is just what it says it is. Authentic India food full of flavor and fresheness! You leave feeling full but not bogged down by unhealthy food. I got the Chai tea and loved when they gave me the teapot with extra. Ended up being about 3 full glasses of tea. Rich in flavor and good service. I highly recommend it to anyone wanting some great indian food!
Review 3: I am very satisfied with everything I had. Everything was delicious. This place made my day. Very tasty food and big portions. The place is very clean and well organized.
Review 4: one of my favorite restaurants & best Indian food in town! our favorites are mango lassi, dum aloo, lamb tikka masala & paneer kulcha. thank you for great service & AMAZING quality food every time!!! the pictures don't do it justice
Review 5: Excellent food and wonderful service.  I would highly recommend the chick pakoras, vegetable samosas, tandoori mixed grill, and the curries.  Also, the Marsala Chai is delicious with free refills.

name: Bombay South Indian Restaurant
working_hours: Sunday: 3-9 PM, Monday: 11 AM-9 PM, Tuesday: 11 AM-9 PM, Wednesday: 11 AM-9 PM, Thursday: 11 AM-9 PM, Friday: 11 AM-9 PM, Saturday: 3-9 PM
Review 1: Now that was some good food.  The tamarind sauce and mint chutney where both very good.  Perfect spice level for the medium tikka masala that included nice cuts of well marinated chicken.  The staff was being extra careful with covid safety as well.
Review 2: Delicious food and good with quantity too. Just be careful while ordering the spice level as we ordered medium spicy and that is way too spicy compared to spice level we usually get in USA
Review 3: Nice restaurant and wonderful staff. Food was terrific must try masala dosa and mango lassi
Review 4: Tried it for the first time tonight, pretty good stuff cooked to order. I had the lamb with medium spice level and it was right.Vegetarian options: It‚Äôs Indian of course they have a veg option
Review 5: The masala dosa was really good, it comes with sambar (the soup-like dish in the upper left). The mango lassi was delicious. The samosas are huge!! Totally worth it, and pairs well with the tamirind sauce.

name: Hari Om Cuisine Of India
working_hours: Sunday: Closed, Monday: 12-9 PM, Tuesday: 12-9 PM, Wednesday: 12-9 PM, Thursday: 12-9 PM, Friday: 12-9 PM, Saturday: 12-9 PM
Review 1: The best Northern Indian food (we asked lol)! We will definitely be back again! We took all our left over home and ordered additional naan bread to eat with our leftovers. My little boy loves everything, especially their masala fries. Customer service was awesome! Overall experience 10/10! Thank you for the wonderful food and service!
Review 2: The BEST place HANDS DOWN to get Indian food far and wide. I love Hari Om's beautiful space and incredibly prepared dishes. They are authentic and  delicious. Amit is very hands on and is usually preparing your food and serving your table. Nothing but the best from Hari Om every time! Thank you for being a little slice of heaven in our frozen tundra. <3 - Heidi Oh & do NOT sleep on the samosas, you will regret it. Plus great healthy vegan friendly options.
Review 3: Really nice good Indian Food. There are a lot vegetarian options and even a few vegan. Why only 4 stars? Because the service took a little bit too long to handout the menu and my seat couch was very broken.
Review 4: Great ambiance and service with a smile. If your looking for real Indian food experience this is the place. The food was very good. I got the Thali Platter which had the chicken massala(?sp) with it. It was a decent sampler of foods but no lamb. Perhaps next time for that.
Review 5: We went for a late dinner after arriving in Fairbanks. This place is has equal numbers of vegetarian vs meat options. My friend got the veggie thali, and I got lamb shahi with garlic naan. Everything was delicious. We finished the meal with hot chai which were spiced perfectly. The staff are very friendly and the interior of the restaurant is super colorful and very serene. Loved the art done by local artists. Definitely recommended!

name: Namaste Shangri-La
working_hours: Sunday: Closed, Monday: 11 AM-2 PM,5-9 PM, Tuesday: 11 AM-2 PM,5-9 PM, Wednesday: 11 AM-2 PM,5-9 PM, Thursday: 11 AM-2 PM,5-9 PM, Friday: 11 AM-2 PM,5-9 PM, Saturday: 11 AM-2 PM,5-9 PM
Review 1: I‚Äôm not sure why this place doesn‚Äôt have a better star rating. It‚Äôs a wonderful option for vegans and vegetarians! Visited for the third time and the food and service were excellent. Can‚Äôt wait to have dinner at Namaste again!
Review 2: Huge portions, enormous menu, delicious food. We got 1/2 order of momos, a veg thali, and a lamb vindaloo and had enough for 2 for dinner plus leftovers for lunch the next day. Definitely recommend this to anyone!
Review 3: Great place! Best Indian food in town! Rich creamy (however light on stomach) sauces and interestingly they have different taste for each one. Freshly made. All the curries were great. Must try their Nepali Kheer. Customer service was so welcoming! All in all, must go place! Highly recommend
Review 4: The best Indian I came across in Anchorage I have the non-chicken curry in the chicken tikka all were exceptional the sauces were fresh and it was all worth the wait five out of five very delicious
Review 5: The best Authentic Nepalese food in Anchorage. Food was great and satisfying , lassi and veggie momos are my family‚Äôs favorite. Servers were very helpful. And the atmosphere is relaxing.

name: Spice Juneau Indian Cuisine
working_hours: Sunday: Closed, Monday: 4-9 PM, Tuesday: 4-9 PM, Wednesday: 4-9 PM, Thursday: 4-9 PM, Friday: 4-9 PM, Saturday: 4-9 PM
Review 1: After dining here a couple of times, I have come to the conclusion that it is my favorite Indian food in all of Juneau. (Honestly, best I've had anywhere) The owner is super nice and added her own spin to popular dishes. If you ask for hot, it will be hot, so if you are white, be careful! The chicken tika is so tender that you can tell the chicken receives special treatments in the back when nobody is looking. Possibly a 24-hour marinate, or who knows, maybe it's been wined and dined before lights out. I would write more, but you all are hungry and  found where you need to go, so get to spice... You will thank me later. Dine in: Yes Outdoor seating: No Takeout: Yes
Review 2: Definitely check out this place when you‚Äôre in Juneau! One of the best restaurants in the area. Sometimes they even have live music. It would be a perfect spot for date night. Great service and even better food!
Review 3: This is my favorite restaurant in Juneau! The food is always fantastic each time we've visited and the service has been great. Highly recommend.
Review 4: The atmosphere was calm, in contrast to the heavy spice smell. The food was amazing  in both flavor, look, and smell. Would go again soon
Review 5: Incredible meal! We were the first customers of today's soft opening and were very satisfied with everything we had. The new owner Nimmy has done an amazing job with the decor and is very passionate about home style cooking. Would paddle our kayaks 300 miles again to Juneau to eat here!

name: Bombay Curry
working_hours: Sunday: Open 24 hours, Monday: Open 24 hours, Tuesday: Open 24 hours, Wednesday: Open 24 hours, Thursday: Open 24 hours, Friday: 11 AM-4 PM, Saturday: 11 AM-4 PM
Review 1: Amazing Indian food! Really warmed our soul after a cold day out. Great for cruise guests as a break from the cruise food. The woman taking care of us was very kind. Highly recommend getting the butter chicken and garlic naan!
Review 2: Adverage curry sold in the back of a clothing store. Still best curry in town. You have to go here if you want curry in skagway because it's the only place. The lady that takes your order is very nice and their kid runs around and will ask you to play games with him while you wait for your food. 3 stars.
Review 3: Very nice taste as this is very near for cruise ship guest and crew. Must try grab grilled naanwich. Sir is specialised in making Naanwich.
Review 4: Some of the best curry I‚Äôve had! Delicious, and prompt. The lady behind the counter was kind. Classic Bollywood movies really set the scene as well. Also for sale were many items including incense which made the shop smell heavenly! 6 stars!
Review 5: Chicken curry and Paneer we're both very good along with mango lassi and masala tea.

name: Everest Restaurant
working_hours: Sunday: 11 AM-3 PM,5-9 PM, Monday: 11 AM-3 PM,5-9 PM, Tuesday: 11 AM-3 PM,5-9 PM, Wednesday: 11 AM-3 PM,5-9 PM, Thursday: 11 AM-3 PM,5-9 PM, Friday: 11 AM-3 PM,5-9 PM, Saturday: 11 AM-3 PM,5-9 PM
Review 1: Very nice restaurant with a wonderful experience. Service is excellent. Food is good, but ask for spicy if you want it as everything is served mild by default. I would recommend the Gobi Manchurian and the Tandoori Grills. The owner is very fun with and has a great smile to greet customers. Vegetarian options: Good options with veggies or paneer. Kid-friendliness: Upscale restaurant. Good for well behaved kids.Parking: Ample Parking. Wheelchair accessibility: Wheelchair Accessible . Dietary restrictions: Vegetarian options
Review 2: Everest has a good selection of vegan options, wonderful service, delicious food and great ambiance. Particularly enjoyed the samosas and the roti. Definitely come try this place, Anchorage is lucky they opened upüôÇ
Review 3: Everest has quickly become a favorite of mine, coming back now several times. Their lunch special (see picture) comes with a variety of delicious sides and a rice dessert to top it off. Their wait staff is amazing. Highly recommend to give them a try!
Review 4: The food was savory and delicious, the service was very attentive and friendly.  Watching the servers bustle around the floor cleaning and setting tables as a team was cool.  We will be back. Vegetarian options: A veg section on the menu and lots of veggies on the menu.
Review 5: Great Indian/Nepalese restaurant. My wife and I ordered the butter chicken, chicken biryani, and some Naan. The butter chicken is the best I've had in many Indian dinners. The biryani was also very good and had many spices in it that delighted my pallet. The Naan was perfectly cooked and was delicious as well. I am already looking forward to my next visit here!

name: Shiva Boom
working_hours: Sunday: Closed, Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12-7:30 PM, Wednesday: 12-7:30 PM, Thursday: 12-7:30 PM, Friday: 12-6 PM, Saturday: Closed
Review 1: Very good food. Had the garlic naan and samosa. Kids didn't like but I loved them. Fast service right after they opened
Review 2: Crunchy, flavorful samosas. Buttery naan. I'll be coming back for the curry. Always busy now , but worth the longer wait. Vegetarian options: Falafel and samosas. Kid-friendliness: Kids liked it. Parking: Ample. Wheelchair accessibility: No impediments noted. Dietary restrictions: Vegetarian friendly
Review 3: The BEST place in town to get food! The samosas are out of this world good and they have some of the BEST falafels I‚Äôve ever tried. Their curry is also packed with flavor, and you can really taste all of the spices (and love) Shiva Boom puts into their food. Shiva Boom has food for everyone, including vegan and gluten free options. My favorite is the falafel bowl with rice and the samosas. Extremely friendly service, outstanding food, and an overall great experience. I really can‚Äôt say enough good things about Shiva Boom, everyone in Homer should come give them a try! ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Review 4: Absolutely delicious curries and naan. Flavorful, fresh ingredients, and always friendly, excellent service by the loveliest duo. I am so happy to have this amazing food offering in Homer.
Review 5: god i freaking love this place. it's my favorite place in town. the samosa are heavenly. the curry is always great. i get the curry of the day every time, along with a samosa. i prefer to rice to naan, but that's just me. the naan is perfectly good, i just like rice. it is so so so so so so so very good. i love this place with my whole heart. please go there. the people are very nice and make very very very good food.

name: Spice It Up
working_hours: Sunday: Closed, Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11 AM-7 PM, Wednesday: 11 AM-7 PM, Thursday: 11 AM-7 PM, Friday: 11 AM-7 PM, Saturday: 12-7 PM
Review 1: My husband and I tried Spice it up for the very first time and it was absolutely delicious. I called it in and it was ready in roughly 15mins. Service was great! Definitely will be back in the future to try different dishes that they offer.
Review 2: I got the lamb it was amazing very good. The bread tortilla that it was wrapped in was so soft and chewy. The naan bread is harder and thin but good still! The somosas we're also super good bigger than I'm used to. People are very nice.
Review 3: Owner took extra time and made sure we were taken care of after parts of our order got mixed up in the lunch rush. Can‚Äôt express how kind and generous he was to us. 10/10
Review 4: I've been getting food here for a while. I love the menu. But then, my man brings back the Naanwich...üî•üî•üî• Now, I have to come back every Saturday for it. Lamb Naanwich.. I'm done!
Review 5: Very plain atmosphere with very good food.  I had the chicken gyro.  Creamy, spicy on naan bread.  Very satisfying.  They do a big take-out business too.

name: Mandala Restaurant
working_hours: Sunday: Closed, Monday: 11:30 AM-2 PM,5-9 PM, Tuesday: 5-9 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM-2 PM,5-9 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM-2 PM,5-9 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM-2 PM,5-9 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM-2 PM,5-9 PM
Review 1: Very delicious authentic flavors, especially loved the spices they used. My wife and I really enjoyed going here. Cozy warm atmosphere. We were the only dine in patrons, but it looks like they do a lot of take out. Really enjoyed the white table cloth experience. Very friendly owner and staff. Would definitely visit again.
Review 2: Some of the best Indian food I've had anywhere (and I've eaten it a lot in many places in several countries)! One example (of many) is the Mango Lassi. Mandala has taken it beyond any 5 star restaurant I've frequented. This holds true for the dishes I've tried. However, there is one minor exception: the samosas were good, just not up to the high standard set by the main-course dishes. That being said, I can't wait to go back!
Review 3: Great place. The food was amazing. It was fresh food with great flavors. Had gajar halwa which was delicious as well. I could not find a single fault in the food nor the service. The chef came out personally to ask us how did we like the food. Please visit this restaurant if you are in anchorage.
Review 4: Thank you for sharing the deliciousness with Kadi pakoda, Seek Kabab, Garlic naan, Masala chai in Clay pot. Thakali Curry, the best and unique taste of country side dish. Kheer prepared with saffron served warm(classic and traditional way of eating after the heavy meal) my family loved it. Warm Gajar halwa another addition to taste here.
Review 5: One of the best Indian restaurants in Anchorage and nationwide that I‚Äôve been to! Exquisite customer service and delicious authentic dishes. Will be coming back again and again!

name: Yak & Yeti Cafe
full_address: 1360 W Northern Lights Blvd, Anchorage, AK 99507
working_hours: Sunday: 11 AM-8 PM, Monday: 10 AM-8 PM, Tuesday: 10 AM-8 PM, Wednesday: 10 AM-8 PM, Thursday: 10 AM-8 PM, Friday: 10 AM-8 PM, Saturday: 10 AM-8 PM
Review 1: The soup is fantastic. Love the turmeric bread for the sandwich and the moreo was just one of the awesome looking baked goods.
Review 2: I've been twice. Incredible food both times. I wish I had this available where I lived I would eat here once a week
Review 3: The chicken marsala and potato soup are savory and cooked to perfection! The desserts and baked goods are also amazing!
Review 4: Be aware the prices on their website menus are out of date. We were not prepared for a  $2 up charge on the rice bowl on top of it being $1 more than advertised. We were hoping for an economical $20 dinner , but at least it was very fast and pretty tasty. Vegetarian options: Multiple options to customize your rice bowl. Parking: Plenty of shared parking
Review 5: Amazing restaurant, with delicious food. The palak paneer is amazing, and frankly is a steal at $11 a meal. The mango Lassi is everything I dreamed of and more. Constructive criticism: The "spicy" dishes are very much toned down for a non-heat tolerant population, but very delicious regardless. Also don't feel bad about adding a bit of salt to the palak paneer. All in all a must try for anyone who loves food from anywhere around India.

name: Capri Pizza
working_hours: Sunday: 11 AM-8 PM, Monday: 10 AM-8 PM, Tuesday: 10 AM-8 PM, Wednesday: 10 AM-8 PM, Thursday: 10 AM-8 PM, Friday: 10 AM-8 PM, Saturday: 10 AM-8 PM
Review 1: Very friendly place run by the owners. I've had the Pakistani seehk kabob roll and the shish kabob pizza. Both were made with all fresh ingredients. The pizza was a pleasant surprise. Was very flavorful. It's a soft crust pizza, would not describe it as a hearty crust (has bend). Fair price and bountiful in toppings without being overloaded. A bit cheese heavy for me, but that is personal preference and I suspect is  perfect for the majority of people. According to the owner they are open regardless of holidays and weather. Not a great place to sit and eat, order ahead recommended.
Review 2: If you get the chance, try this local locally owned food. They home make all their Pizza's and it was amazing. Hands down, the best pizza I ever had!
Review 3: We came in late on the train and after both Wendy‚Äôs and McDonalds were closed we were fortunate enough to walk by this little place. Great sandwiches at a very reasonable price and we even have leftovers for tomorrow. The owner was so nice and I‚Äôm glad we got to support local business. The whole experience really turned our night around. We‚Äôll definitely be back next time we‚Äôre in town.
Review 4: While the lady in the front seems like she is having a bad day, the pizza was delicious! We had the veggie pizza and the vegetables were fresh and the cheese they used was so much better than other pizzas I‚Äôve tasted before. Will definitely be come back for more.
Review 5: Family owned restaurant, quality food, and exceptionally priced. To my knowledge it's a man and his wife. If they deliver to you, it's usually the dude that cooked the food driving it to you. If you ask for a delivery during a food rush, it might take a while for them to get it to you. Just be patient and prepare your stomach for some sensational cuisine. I ordered my first pizza (Mamma Mia) from them yesterday and had it delivered. Well worth the wait. Halal food.
